Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with traces of two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of possible 'chimaera' (body, parts of hind legs, upper part of foreleg, part of neck and horn remaining), to right; dotted circle and swastika as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For a discussion on the creature possibly being a chimaera, see Lemos 1991, 42. Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 41-2, fig. 23, p. 73, p. 251, no. 384, pl. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0140) (phase 2)
